snippet: President Mohamed Morsi has remained silent about the future of the family planning programs put in place by the government of former President Hosni Mubarak.
abstract: Egypt's birthrate in 2012 reached about 32 for every 1,000 people, surpassing level last seen in 1991 before government of Pres Hosni Mubarak expanded family planning programs and publicity campaign to curtail population growth that he blamed for crippling country's development; experts are alarmed not only by the growing population but by new Islamist government's silence on the issue.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Asmaa Al Zohairy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi has remained silent about the future of the family planning programs put in place by the government of former President Hosni Mubarak.

headline.seo: As Egypt Birthrate Rises, Population Policy Vanishes
headline.main: Egypt’s Birthrate Rises as Population Control Policies Vanish
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Birthrate Rises as Population Control Policies Vanish
